ygData.messageBody:
Totally understand your gripe. Sounds like you
were in a bad group, with bad spell casters, but I've
not heard their side of the story. <br><br>It's never
more frustrating for a spell caster than running out
of mana, telling the party that you are out of mana
(OOM!), and they still pull. Also, you should have had
SOW on you...run in circle while your casters MED to
avoid getting hit. A caster CAN NOT get that MOB off of
you without a spell...when a caster hits for 12-20
points of damage, the MOBS in unrest won't get
distracted from Aggroing on a tank who's done 200 pts of
damage on it.<br><br>So, ensure that you are buffed
before every pull...including SOW. If your casters are
OOM, don't pull...in fact, if they are below 50% mana
(50m), don't pull!<br><br>Now why the healer healed the
80% health wizard...I can only guess he/she was
either a friend, or had the wrong target.<br><br>Melee
class and caster class group well together. The rely
totally on each other. If one side fails, the other
suffers...it sucks, but it's reality. Simply don't group with
those casters any longer.<br><br>As a druid, I've had
problems with both types in a group, but I can GATE, HEAL,
and SOW myself out of trouble - even if the group is
bad! But, as an enchanter, I am totally dependant on
the group to know their roles and know them well.
Healers must HEAL before looting, Tanks/Pullers must
guard while medding, etc. During battle, I mes the
adds, I debuff the mobs and buff the tank. It's a
simple game with incredibly COMPLEX role-playing that
needs to happen in groups.<br><br>For every story you
can share about bad casters, I can share about bad
tanks/pullers. Learn from mistakes, give constructive critisism
to the group, if they listen, GREAT, you're group
will improve. If not, DISBAND, and find some good
casters.<br><br>CoJim, Druid of the 24th season.
